access: Agents of the Aspis Consortium have access to this weapon.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Asp Coil](/Weapons.aspx?ID=233)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Reach" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=192" />
<trait label="Versatile P" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 105</row>

**Access** Agents of the Aspis Consortium have access to this weapon.

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**Damage** 1d6 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)
</row>

</column>

---

The asp coil, named both for its slithering striking style and its usage among Aspis Consortium agents, has two forms. In sword form, it resembles an elegant, oddly balanced sword. However, with a twist of the pommel, the blade splits into a series of segments connected by elaborate metal cables.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-15" />
